channel.title: How to keep JaGeX off your Ass for a little Longer
channel.description:
I've always noticed how they always talk about distributing their intellectual property, blah, blah, blah.
Make a loader. Something that grabs the client from an external place and reads the cache from the website or something. Therefore you aren't infringing on distributing their software.
This is more of a discussion thread as I want to know opinions on if this would work.

item.title: How to keep JaGeX off your Ass for a little Longer
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

Lin:

Really, when you think about it, there’s nothing illegal when all you’re doing is distributing a link - something that’s kept MoparScape and I believe Warez-BB alive

This sounds like a good way to go i guess

Read full topic
item.source: How to keep JaGeX off your Ass for a little Longer

item.title: How to keep JaGeX off your Ass for a little Longer
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

If you don’t directly reward items for donations, that could possibly help. Like SS, or even my Server. Reward points or credits for donating and then further later in game they can spend them.

Read full topic
item.source: How to keep JaGeX off your Ass for a little Longer

item.title: How to keep JaGeX off your Ass for a little Longer
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

[quote=“Lin, post:4, topic:478556”]I already came up with this idea a while ago and suggested Davidi2 do it. I told Taharok and he said the problem with that is something along the lines of soliciting illegal activity. Really, when you think about it, there’s nothing illegal when all you’re doing is distributing a link - something that’s kept MoparScape and I believe Warez-BB alive - but you still made modifications to the client and I’m not sure how far that goes.

Something you could do to really keep them off your ass is pay for everything out of your own pocket and don’t accept any money. I don’t think they care about servers enough to take them down if you’re not making any money.[/quote]
There would be no point in hosting a server if this is the case, not unless you really enjoy spending a pocket full of money on something that is just mere nostalgia.

Read full topic
item.source: How to keep JaGeX off your Ass for a little Longer

item.title: How to keep JaGeX off your Ass for a little Longer
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

More or less yes, but they can still try and get you for it.

Read full topic
item.source: How to keep JaGeX off your Ass for a little Longer

item.title: How to keep JaGeX off your Ass for a little Longer
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

[quote=“Lin, post:4, topic:478556”]I already came up with this idea a while ago and suggested Davidi2 do it. I told Taharok and he said the problem with that is something along the lines of soliciting illegal activity. Really, when you think about it, there’s nothing illegal when all you’re doing is distributing a link - something that’s kept MoparScape and I believe Warez-BB alive - but you still made modifications to the client and I’m not sure how far that goes.

Something you could do to really keep them off your ass is pay for everything out of your own pocket and don’t accept any money. I don’t think they care about servers enough to take them down if you’re not making any money.[/quote]So by just linking people you’re able to avoid the claim they have on you distributing their software?

Read full topic
item.source: How to keep JaGeX off your Ass for a little Longer

item.title: How to keep JaGeX off your Ass for a little Longer
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

I remember reading on the Unity boards that if someone pirates the Pro version and releases a free game, it’s unlikely that they’ll go to the trouble of doing anything - I guess that this could also apply here?

Read full topic
item.source: How to keep JaGeX off your Ass for a little Longer

item.title: How to keep JaGeX off your Ass for a little Longer
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

I already came up with this idea a while ago and suggested Davidi2 do it. I told Taharok and he said the problem with that is something along the lines of soliciting illegal activity. Really, when you think about it, there’s nothing illegal when all you’re doing is distributing a link - something that’s kept MoparScape and I believe Warez-BB alive - but you still made modifications to the client and I’m not sure how far that goes.

Something you could do to really keep them off your ass is pay for everything out of your own pocket and don’t accept any money. I don’t think they care about servers enough to take them down if you’re not making any money.

Read full topic
item.source: How to keep JaGeX off your Ass for a little Longer

item.title: How to keep JaGeX off your Ass for a little Longer
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

You aren’t distributing their code. About the client and cache, there has to be some place where its accessible and isn’t actually distributing.

Read full topic
item.source: How to keep JaGeX off your Ass for a little Longer

item.title: How to keep JaGeX off your Ass for a little Longer
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

when you say read the cache from the website do you mean the one you own or another one? Because if you host the cache you will still be distributing their property. Also I doubt this would even hold up in a court case because using an applet to grab the client and cache from another location is still distributing the software, I don’t really see a real viable option for getting around the distribution of their code.

Read full topic
item.source: How to keep JaGeX off your Ass for a little Longer
